pic1_alt: Logo for United Nations Office for Outer Space Affairs. Icon is a radar map with the continents of the world on them and a laurel around the outside of the radar map and the words United Nations Office for Outer Space Affairs next to the icon.
pic2_alt: Annual number of objects launched into space, 2023. This includes satellites, probes, landers, crewed spacecrafts, and space station flight elements launched into Earth orbit or beyond. Map of the world with a heatmap indicating where entities have launced objects into space. Darker colors are more objects. The United States is the darkest, then China, then Russia. There are lighter colors in Australia, South America and Europe. Very few in Africa, except for South Africa and Egypt. Data source: United Nations Office for Outer Space Affairs (2024). OurWorldInData.org/space-exploration-satellites. CC-BY.
